contentrichtext.text: {{enzyme | Name = xylono-1,4-lactonase | EC_number = 3.1.1.68 | CAS_number = | IUBMB_EC_number = 3/1/1/68 | GO_code = 0050402 | image = | width = | caption = }} In [[enzymology]], a '''xylono-1,4-lactonase''' ({{EC number|3.1.1.68}}) is an [[enzyme]] that [[catalysis|catalyzes]] the [[chemical reaction]] :D-xylono-1,4-lactone + H<sub>2</sub>O <math>\rightleftharpoons</math> D-xylonate Thus, the two [[substrate (biochemistry)|substrates]] of this enzyme are [[D-xylono-1,4-lactone]] and [[water|H<sub>2</sub>O]], whereas its [[product (chemistry)|product]] is [[D-xylonate]]. This enzyme belongs to the family of [[hydrolase]]s, specifically those acting on carboxylic [[ester]] bonds. The systematic name of this enzyme class is '''D-xylono-1,4-lactone lactonohydrolase'''. Other names in common use include '''xylono-g-lactonase''', and '''xylonolactonase'''. This enzyme participates in [[pentose and glucuronate interconversions]]. ==References== {{reflist|1}} {{refbegin}} * {{cite journal | author = Buchert J and Viikari L | date = 1988 | title = The role of xylonolactone in xylonic acid production by Pseudomonas fragi | journal = Appl. Microbiol. Biotechnol. | volume = 27 | pages = 333–336 }} {{refend}} {{refbegin}} {{hydrolase-stub}} [[Category:EC 3.1.1]] [[Category:Enzymes of unknown structure]]
